story:
Imagine a world where mindfulness is taught from the ages of four to fourteen. That’s ten years of schooling dedicated to teaching our future generation how to breathe with intention, how to use all of our senses to appreciate life and how to cultivate a lasting relationship with our natural world. A place where emotions and feelings are valued, understood and talked about. Where people actively listen to one another instead of needing to get the next word in. A place where gratefulness, community, and celebration come before fear, anxiety and doubt. This is what you are creating through your donations. This is Camp Begin. 

 

What binds us together? 

Hi. My name is Moira and I am alive and breathing just like you. I am a teacher, wife, dog-mom, daughter, sister, niece, aunt, granddaughter and friend. I work hard, play hard and laugh a lot. I cry seldom, smile more, but never stop thinking. I think about what was, what could be and plan for what's next. I get in bad moods sometimes and lash out at people who don't deserve it. I have more anxiety than I let on and get stressed-out trying to balance my work life with my personal life. A struggle I face is being married to someone with chronic pain who can't always enjoy life the way I can. The most difficult thing I've had to deal with thus far has been my brother's loss to suicide. Life is hard. Unfortunately, I don't see that changing. And I am positive you would agree. Maybe you've suffered from divorce, loss, car accidents, bankruptcy, depression, or something else. Our stories are surely different and unique in their own way, but I see the obstacles we all face as the glue that binds us together. 

What if you would have learned how to cope with life at a young age? Wouldn't that have been great? Most of the time I spent in school was focused on learning math, reading and science. But what I needed was guidance on how to deal. I needed a way to express myself. A place to be heard instead of being lost in a big class or in my family of eight. I needed to learn how to breathe and calm down instead of screaming at my parents, siblings and friends when I didn't get what I wanted. In high school I used to go outside to play basketball when I'd get upset. One day I came inside and my mom asked me, "Moira, what's wrong?" I snapped back sort of surprised, "how did you know something is wrong?" She kindly replied, "Because you always go outside when you are upset." Something clicked for me in that moment and now I often wonder what my life would have been like if I consciously understood the NEED I have to spend 30 minutes outside every day in nature. 

By investing, you can help shape how our future generation reacts to life’s obstacles and setbacks. You can help build a community of people who know and value the importance of time spent in nature, play and self-expression. How we react is what shapes us and defines our very existence. Your gift will set the tone for a more compassionate and less reactionary world.    

Trust that this journey led me to you

Hi, again, I would like to re-introduce myself through the lens of my career path. My name is Moira Colleen Farrell, founder and owner of Hike and Heal Wellness's "Camp Begin." I am a kindergarten, first and second grade Physical Education teacher. The highlights of my day are playing with my dog, doing life with my wife and without question being inspired by my students. In addition to teaching general PE, I also teach a kindergarten self-regulation class centered in mindfulness. I am a member of their action research team and graduate of Breathe for Change, an organization that offers the only 200-hour Yoga certification in the world specifically geared towards building educator wellness. I have my bachelors degree in Physical Education with certifications in Adapted PE, Health Education, Ropes Course Facilitation, Sea Kayaking, and Yoga. Before working in public education, I worked at an experiential learning center for nearly a decade. I fell in love with the creation and facilitation of youth and adult leadership programs which had a profound influence in the creation of Camp Begin. Without these experiences, I wouldn’t be here connecting with you. Unfortunately accolades can't stand alone to create this camp that the Madison community and broader world needs. Only you can. Trust that the journey I've been on will take this camp you invest in beyond our expectations.  

Help prevent our current societal problems

  1. Society fosters speed vs. awareness. Kids are growing up in a fast-paced, demanding world that stresses quick reaction versus critical thought. Have a question? Google it. Don't know how to spell that word? Autocorrect has it covered. Hungry? Let's go through the drive through. Bored? Watch a movie. We are constantly plugged in, thinking about who has liked our post, what comments we’ve missed, and more. Kids younger and younger are given cell phones from protective parents who need to ensure their child's safety while simultaneously meeting their child's social needs. In education, administrators want impactful staff development workshops in 30-60 minute chunks. Our society values speed and self-gratification high above the need to cultivate awareness for the present moment. Luckily, your donation to Camp Begin can help.
  2. We have unplugged from nature and play. Our plugged-in culture has created the largest disconnect to nature in history. The more technology we put ourselves in front of, the more green space we need. Our bodies crave the outdoors to recharge, slow down and breathe deeply. Current research suggests aspects of nature directly correlate to mental and emotional health. Author Richard Louv writes that kids growing up in urban neighborhoods may be suffering from Nature Deficit Disorder, the notion that spending less time outdoors results in a wide range of behavioral problems. Our need for nature is much like our need for unstructured play. In Madison, WI elementary schools, kids aging from 6-10 only get one recess per day unless their teacher blocks out extra time. This is a problem because as our brain develops, neural pathways are built through unstructured, creative play. Without it, we become socially inept, lack creativity and have poor problem solving skills. By donating, you can help people recognize our inherent need for nature and play for a more balanced, healthy life.
  3. Leadership is not "core curriculum." When I was teaching leadership development, it was absolutely clear that my job was needed and seen as important. Kids lacked conversation skills, faced self-esteem issues, didn't understand what it meant to hold others accountable often struggled showcasing personal responsibility. Now that I teach in public schools, I recognize that some teachers do take the time to teach leadership. But they aren't required to and it won’t become a common core class anytime soon. So if it isn't required in school, where will kids learn it? By donating, you will make leadership programming accessible for low-income families. Your scholarships will allow teachers to recommend students who don’t currently have the skills that need it. By donating today, you are creating awareness for the need to lead.
  4. Big numbers, low quality, average results. Popular summer camps are typically huge. They house a lot of campers, require a big staff and struggle producing quality results. Their instructors are high school or college students who can be minimally paid in exchange for summer housing. They teach more from trial and error versus experience. By donating to Camp Begin, you are investing in hard-working, certified educators who need a second job to stay afloat. In Wisconsin, teachers are underpaid and are full of anxiety. In Madison, 73% of teachers report that they face extreme levels of mental, emotional and physical stress every day. New teachers are quitting faster and seasoned educators are retiring early. Your donation will help teachers revive and practice their passion for nature, mindfulness, play and creative arts therapy. Your donation allows us to honor quality education by paying teachers a desirable wage.

Become part of the solution

Camp Begin’s mission is to start kids out at age four, with continued learning every summer through age fourteen. If my math works out, a parent of a four-year old in Madison, WI will have the opportunity to enrich their child's life with 1600 hours of mindful-nature programming before their sweet sixteen birthday.

4k - 2nd Grade | 8am - 12pm, Monday - Friday up to 5 weeks for 4 summers.  

3rd - 8th Grade | 8am - 4pm, Monday - Friday up to 5 weeks for 6 summers.

That's 96,000 minutes dedicated to coping with life's ups and downs, learning how to make sense of our world, building self-esteem, living in the present moment, learning yoga, mindfulness, meditation, leadership skills and how to show expression through creative arts.

 

By helping fund Camp Begin, you are helping shape a better world.

 

Your donation will...

  1. Instill awareness for the present moment
  2. Showcase the importance of nature and play on our well-being
  3. Foster a #mindfulgeneration that is empathetic and compassionate
  4. Influence people to practice self-care
  5. Create jobs for hard-working, quality educators
  6. Grow creative thinkers and problem solvers
  7. Encourage a positive self-image for all involved
  8. Spread more success stories than sob stories
  9. Honor self-expression through creative arts
  10. Teach more people how to lead with positive intentions

Impact millions of people

With projections of fifty campers per week for five weeks, you can influence 250 lives directly through your donation. Then, when you consider the youth participants AND their parents your impact grows. Add in camp volunteers, the instructors and all of the people these individuals will come into contact, you're looking at influencing thousands of people. Now here's something even cooler. Hike and Heal Wellness is collaborating with Breathe for Change (B4C) for an even broader reach. B4C will be assisting with curriculum development, marketing, research and eventually helping disseminate the brand across the nation. Yes, you read that right. By creating this camp through your donation today, you are helping start social change. Soon, Camp Begin will be a national brand that families across the country will begin to recognize. Together, we will be influencing millions of people.

 

Create scholarships, jobs and a #mindfulgeneration

90% of the funds raised here will go directly towards camper scholarships and supplementing certified teacher wages. The other 10% will be used for start-up overhead. We offer full, $400 scholarships for low-income families, half scholarships for $200 and quarter scholarships for $100. Certified Teachers will receive up to an additional $100/week in scholarships from your donations.

Indulge in THE PERKS  

  • Sport your new Camp Begin t-shirt with pride!

  • Enjoy videos and pictures of the camper you "adopted!"

  • Receive special art decor from our students to display!

  • Get BIG discounts on Hike and Heal Wellness adult programs!

  • Use mindfulness curriculum in your home with the help of our family wellness guide!

  • Look cool and get bragging rights for supporting something fun and meaningful!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Are you a teacher? Have friends that teach? Take an inventory of all of your students. Which 5 would benefit the most? Give their parents the registration form or send us their contact information!
  • Spread the word on social media about #HikeandHeal! Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and Google+.
  • Know a corporation that might be interested in sponsoring our students or teachers? Please reach out to Moira Farrell at info@hikeandheal.com.
  • We are lucky to have a fabulous group of volunteers that are part of the Hike and Heal Wellness Community. If you are interested in getting involved, we would LOVE to hear from you! Please email Elizabeth Kiser at beth@hikeandheal.com.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? No, which means your donation is not tax deductible. Your gift is an investment in me and this business venture I am embarking on. Rest assured, 90% of the funds received will go towards camper and teachers scholarships while the remaining 10% will be used to help with start-up costs (i.e. liability insurance, building fees, etc).

How will the funds be used? 90% of the funds received will go towards camper and teacher scholarships while the remaining 10% will be used to help with start-up costs (i.e. liability insurance, building fees, etc).

Can I donate from outside the USA? Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. 

What payment methods do you accept? Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

When will I get my perks? Each perk has an estimated delivery month/year listed in the description. You will be notified of any delays.

Will any perks go out before the campaign is completed? Unfortunately, no.

If I donate, How do I tell you what t-shirt size I need? After the campaign is over, we will reach out to you directly to ask your for your size and color preference! Look out for an email from the Hike and Heal Team in early March!

What if I want more than one perk? You can make multiple gifts on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person.

What if I want one of the perks and it is sold out? Some perks are only available in limited quantities because of their special nature. So get these perks while they’re hot and contribute now! If possible, we will increase the number of a few limited release perks and we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the campaign. Stay tuned!

Is shipping included? Yes!

How much is shipping? What if I'm an international donor? Shipping is included in the perk price, regardless of your location. If you would like to offset the cost of international shipping, we welcome additional gifts of any amount (THANK YOU!). To do this, simply add an additional gift amount during your perk purchase/check out.

I have more questions. Who do I ask? Please email us at: info@hikeandheal.com. We'd love to hear from you, and will get back to you as soon as we can!

I snapped back sort of surprised, "how did you know something is wrong?" She kindly replied, "Because you always go outside when you are upset." Something clicked for me in that moment and now I often wonder what my life would have been like if I consciously understood the NEED I have to spend 30 minutes outside every day in nature. 
By investing, you can help shape how our future generation reacts to life’s obstacles and setbacks. You can help build a community of people who know and value the importance of time spent in nature, play and self-expression. How we react is what shapes us and defines our very existence. Your gift will set the tone for a more compassionate and less reactionary world.    

Trust that this journey led me to you
Hi, again, I would like to re-introduce myself through the lens of my career path. My name is Moira Colleen Farrell, founder and owner of Hike and Heal Wellness's "Camp Begin." I am a kindergarten, first and second grade Physical Education teacher. The highlights of my day are playing with my dog, doing life with my wife and without question being inspired by my students. In addition to teaching general PE, I also teach a kindergarten self-regulation class centered in mindfulness. I am a member of their action research team and graduate of Breathe for Change, an organization that offers the only 200-hour Yoga certification in the world specifically geared towards building educator wellness. I have my bachelors degree in Physical Education with certifications in Adapted PE, Health Education, Ropes Course Facilitation, Sea Kayaking, and Yoga. Before working in public education, I worked at an experiential learning center for nearly a decade. I fell in love with the creation and facilitation of youth and adult leadership programs which had a profound influence in the creation of Camp Begin. Without these experiences, I wouldn’t be here connecting with you. Unfortunately accolades can't stand alone to create this camp that the Madison community and broader world needs. Only you can. Trust that the journey I've been on will take this camp you invest in beyond our expectations.  

Help prevent our current societal problems


Society fosters speed vs. awareness. Kids are growing up in a fast-paced, demanding world that stresses quick reaction versus critical thought. Have a question? Google it. Don't know how to spell that word? Autocorrect has it covered. Hungry? Let's go through the drive through. Bored? Watch a movie. We are constantly plugged in, thinking about who has liked our post, what comments we’ve missed, and more. Kids younger and younger are given cell phones from protective parents who need to ensure their child's safety while simultaneously meeting their child's social needs. In education, administrators want impactful staff development workshops in 30-60 minute chunks. Our society values speed and self-gratification high above the need to cultivate awareness for the present moment. Luckily, your donation to Camp Begin can help.

We have unplugged from nature and play. Our plugged-in culture has created the largest disconnect to nature in history. The more technology we put ourselves in front of, the more green space we need. Our bodies crave the outdoors to recharge, slow down and breathe deeply. Current research suggests aspects of nature directly correlate to mental and emotional health. Author Richard Louv writes that kids growing up in urban neighborhoods may be suffering from Nature Deficit Disorder, the notion that spending less time outdoors results in a wide range of behavioral problems. Our need for nature is much like our need for unstructured play. In Madison, WI elementary schools, kids aging from 6-10 only get one recess per day unless their teacher blocks out extra time. This is a problem because as our brain develops, neural pathways are built through unstructured, creative play. Without it, we become socially inept, lack creativity and have poor problem solving skills. By donating, you can help people recognize our inherent need for nature and play for a more balanced, healthy life.

Leadership is not "core curriculum." When I was teaching leadership development, it was absolutely clear that my job was needed and seen as important. Kids lacked conversation skills, faced self-esteem issues, didn't understand what it meant to hold others accountable often struggled showcasing personal responsibility. Now that I teach in public schools, I recognize that some teachers do take the time to teach leadership. But they aren't required to and it won’t become a common core class anytime soon. So if it isn't required in school, where will kids learn it? By donating, you will make leadership programming accessible for low-income families. Your scholarships will allow teachers to recommend students who don’t currently have the skills that need it. By donating today, you are creating awareness for the need to lead.

Big numbers, low quality, average results. Popular summer camps are typically huge. They house a lot of campers, require a big staff and struggle producing quality results. Their instructors are high school or college students who can be minimally paid in exchange for summer housing. They teach more from trial and error versus experience. By donating to Camp Begin, you are investing in hard-working, certified educators who need a second job to stay afloat. In Wisconsin, teachers are underpaid and are full of anxiety. In Madison, 73% of teachers report that they face extreme levels of mental, emotional and physical stress every day. New teachers are quitting faster and seasoned educators are retiring early. Your donation will help teachers revive and practice their passion for nature, mindfulness, play and creative arts therapy. Your donation allows us to honor quality education by paying teachers a desirable wage.


Become part of the solution
Camp Begin’s mission is to start kids out at age four, with continued learning every summer through age fourteen. If my math works out, a parent of a four-year old in Madison, WI will have the opportunity to enrich their child's life with 1600 hours of mindful-nature programming before their sweet sixteen birthday.
4k - 2nd Grade | 8am - 12pm, Monday - Friday up to 5 weeks for 4 summers.  
3rd - 8th Grade | 8am - 4pm, Monday - Friday up to 5 weeks for 6 summers.
That's 96,000 minutes dedicated to coping with life's ups and downs, learning how to make sense of our world, building self-esteem, living in the present moment, learning yoga, mindfulness, meditation, leadership skills and how to show expression through creative arts.
 
By helping fund Camp Begin, you are helping shape a better world.
 
Your donation will...

Instill awareness for the present moment
Showcase the importance of nature and play on our well-being
Foster a #mindfulgeneration that is empathetic and compassionate
Influence people to practice self-care
Create jobs for hard-working, quality educators
Grow creative thinkers and problem solvers
Encourage a positive self-image for all involved
Spread more success stories than sob stories
Honor self-expression through creative arts
Teach more people how to lead with positive intentions


Impact millions of people
With projections of fifty campers per week for five weeks, you can influence 250 lives directly through your donation. Then, when you consider the youth participants AND their parents your impact grows. Add in camp volunteers, the instructors and all of the people these individuals will come into contact, you're looking at influencing thousands of people. Now here's something even cooler. Hike and Heal Wellness is collaborating with Breathe for Change (B4C) for an even broader reach. B4C will be assisting with curriculum development, marketing, research and eventually helping disseminate the brand across the nation. Yes, you read that right. By creating this camp through your donation today, you are helping start social change. Soon, Camp Begin will be a national brand that families across the country will begin to recognize. Together, we will be influencing millions of people.
 
Create scholarships, jobs and a #mindfulgeneration
90% of the funds raised here will go directly towards camper scholarships and supplementing certified teacher wages. The other 10% will be used for start-up overhead. We offer full, $400 scholarships for low-income families, half scholarships for $200 and quarter scholarships for $100. Certified Teachers will receive up to an additional $100/week in scholarships from your donations.

Indulge in THE PERKS  

Sport your new Camp Begin t-shirt with pride!
Enjoy videos and pictures of the camper you "adopted!"
Receive special art decor from our students to display!
Get BIG discounts on Hike and Heal Wellness adult programs!
Use mindfulness curriculum in your home with the help of our family wellness guide!
Look cool and get bragging rights for supporting something fun and meaningful!

 
Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a teacher? Have friends that teach? Take an inventory of all of your students. Which 5 would benefit the most? Give their parents the registration form or send us their contact information!
Spread the word on social media about #HikeandHeal! Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and Google+.
Know a corporation that might be interested in sponsoring our students or teachers? Please reach out to Moira Farrell at info@hikeandheal.com.
We are lucky to have a fabulous group of volunteers that are part of the Hike and Heal Wellness Community. If you are interested in getting involved, we would LOVE to hear from you! Please email Elizabeth Kiser at beth@hikeandheal.com.

 Frequently Asked QuestionsAre you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? No, which means your donation is not tax deductible. Your gift is an investment in me and this business venture I am embarking on. Rest assured, 90% of the funds received will go towards camper and teachers scholarships while the remaining 10% will be used to help with start-up costs (i.e. liability insurance, building fees, etc).How will the funds be used? 90% of the funds received will go towards camper and teacher scholarships while the remaining 10% will be used to help with start-up costs (i.e. liability insurance, building fees, etc).Can I donate from outside the USA? Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. What payment methods do you accept? Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.When will I get my perks? Each perk has an estimated delivery month/year listed in the description. You will be notified of any delays.Will any perks go out before the campaign is completed? Unfortunately, no.If I donate, How do I tell you what t-shirt size I need? After the campaign is over, we will reach out to you directly to ask your for your size and color preference! Look out for an email from the Hike and Heal Team in early March!What if I want more than one perk? You can make multiple gifts on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person.What if I want one of the perks and it is sold out? Some perks are only available in limited quantities because of their special nature. So get these perks while they’re hot and contribute now! If possible, we will increase the number of a few limited release perks and we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the campaign. Stay tuned!Is shipping included? Yes!How much is shipping? What if I'm an international donor? Shipping is included in the perk price, regardless of your location. If you would like to offset the cost of international shipping, we welcome additional gifts of any amount (THANK YOU!). To do this, simply add an additional gift amount during your perk purchase/check out.I have more questions. Who do I ask? Please email us at: info@hikeandheal.com. We'd love to hear from you, and will get back to you as soon as we can!

story:
My name is Dr. Will Perry, I am a Physical Therapist who has over 18 years experience with treating patients with all types of disabilties with most of my time spent treating orthopedic conditions, with many of these injuries were the result of a fall. My purpose is to not just treat these injuries but try to prevent them from happening in the first place. These injuries can result in a loss of: income, jobs, homes, use of an arm or a leg, independence, self esteem, etc.  my endeavor will help prevent many of these injuries, improve quality of life and save people and our health care system money. Think of people you may know who have been injured and what has happened to their quality of life. I had a mother-in-law who was 92 and healthy, drove a Mustang GT convertible, she thought she was still 30.  Then she fell and broke her hip. She lost her indepence, could no longer drive, ended up in a nursing home and within 2 years had passed away. 

I am seeking $55,000 in funding to purchase the necessary equipment. The cost of the specialized equipment I need is $55,000.  If I do not receive the necessary funds I will not be able to proceed without the specialized equipment.

The Impact

1/3 of the population over 65 falls each year

In patients over 75, imbalance is the #1 reason for a doctor visit

Falls account for 25% of all hospital admissions

Falls are the #1 cause of fractures

Falls account for 40% of all nursing home admissions 

At least half of the overall United States population is affected by a balance or vestibular disorder sometime during their lives.

Approximately 15 out of every 1000 individuals consult their family physician each year with complaints of vertigo, dizziness, or imbalance; half the individuals over the age of 65 will develop positional vertigo.

Of all falls suffered by the elderly, 50% are reported to be the result of vestibular problems.

In approximately 15% of vestibular patients, the cause cannot be recognized.

Vestibular dysfunction is a prominent part of balance disorders, particularly in the elderly, and is a significant source of morbidity.

It has been estimated that 65% of individuals older than 60 years of age experience dizziness or loss of balance, often on a daily basis. 

Dizziness is a common symptom affecting about 30% of people over the age of 65.

Approximately 12.5 million Americans over the age of 65 have a dizziness or balance problem that significantly interferes with their lives.

In the US, the estimated cost of medical care for patients with balance disorders exceeds $1 billion annually.

Dizziness can be difficult to diagnose, particularly in elderly persons, in whom it often represents dysfunction in more than one body system.

Many cases of dizziness are actually neurological.

Risks & Challenges

Once I am funded my biggest challenge will be getting enough people that need this service in the door.  This is why so much is devoted to marketing up front.  My partner in this venture has extensive background in marketing to the medical community and the general public as well.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is John Livingstone and I am a cancer survivor. I am excited about new, but little-known advances in treating cancer with immunologic therapies.  Successful immunologic therapies cause our immune system to reprogram its cells so that they can then kill cancer cells. Please contribute to our project so we can create an easy-to-use database of success stories where patients benefitted from this therapy. Our goal is that cancer patients may learn more about these new medicines and research their own cure. Thank you.

Founder’s Cancer Story and Vision:

I have discovered even the best cancer doctors cannot know everything!

In 2007, I noticed a rash on my skin. My family doctor expressed concern as the area had become quite alarming. He arranged a deep biopsy by a dermatologist. 

The diagnosis was a rare form of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma.  I was referred to an oncologist who said the prognosis was poor since there was no known cure.

The lesson about research that I was about to learn has prompted me to form a team and create ImmunoDigest.com.

I am fortunate to have good research skills, probably due to my career as a writer and publisher. I began researching my type of lymphoma and why it was so rare.

Research led me to visit Cancer Treatment Centers of America in Tulsa. After extensive testing and consultation, they advised me they had no treatment for my cancer.  They suggested I contact University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston. MD Anderson had the same horrible prognosis.

I continued my research and found the proverbial “needle in a haystack” – a doctor at UCLA Medical Center who was studying my type of lymphoma. Her name is Dr. Lauren Pinter-Brown, a Clinical Professor of Medicine. I give thanks to Dr. Joseph Castrejon, my family doctor, and Dr. Pinter-Brown that I am here ten years later.

It became clear to me that due to lack of information on the part of some oncologists, patients can die. This is not to fault doctors as they are extremely busy and there are so many new developments to be studied.

For most people diagnosed with cancer, especially a potentially terminal case, the ability to research their own case is overwhelming. I have been working for several years on a solution.  I believe ImmunoDigest.com is one answer - an easy-to-use database of immunotherapy success stories so patients may learn more about new medicines and help to research their own cure.

What information will be available on ImmunoDigest.com?

ImmunoDigest.com will offer:

  • documented survivors’ stories from mainstream sources (see examples on this page)
  • reported science-based treatments
  • information from accredited hospitals and research institutions

It will be a database that is searchable by:

  • cancer type
  • cancer location (breast, spleen, lungs, stomach, etc)
  • immunologic therapies used
  • hospital or research facility
  • doctor
  • country of treatment
  • source of information (with an active link to the survivor’s success story)

Understanding Immunologic Therapies:

Cancer starts with some of a person’s cells becoming cancerous. These cancer cells can become a blood, bone, lung or another type of cancer, which may evolve to become tumors. For some cancers, new drug therapies use the patient’s own cells in their immune system and re-program these cells into tumor-specific T-cells. These re-programmed cells become “weapons” that will destroy the cancerous cells – ideally forever!  It is essentially personalized medicine as everyone’s cancer is different.  The results can be incredible as shown in some of the case studies on this page.

Are immunologic therapies supported by research scientists and the medical community?

Absolutely! There are an estimated 100,000 cancer patients in the USA being treated with immunologic therapies.  More than 180,000 scientific papers were published in 2016 about immunologic therapies.

New immunotherapy treatments are being discovered and used worldwide to cure otherwise terminal patients. Major medical centers in the USA including Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Stanford University, University of California, Los Angeles, University of California, San Francisco, the University of Pennsylvania, and the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center are collaborating with the Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy.  Most major medical centers, offering cancer treatment, are participating in research programs, as well as treating patients.  IBM’s Watson for Genomics, working with Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, is assisting medical personnel by providing personalized approaches and medicine to cancer patients across America and overseas.

Two videos of medical doctors explaining immunologic therapies are shown in the Q & A section below.

Who will find ImmunoDigest.com useful?

Cancer patients (possibly you, a family member or friend) and their advocates who have received an advanced stage, or terminal prognosis will find ImmunoDigest.com useful.

Simplifying hundreds of scientific articles, especially successful case histories, into actionable, easy-to-understand information is the goal of ImmunoDigest.com

According to the National Cancer Institute, on their Cancer.gov website, in 2016 there were an estimated 1,685,000 new cases of cancer in the US and 595,690 deaths. One in four deaths in America is cancer related. Approximately 39% of men and women will be diagnosed with cancer during their lifetimes.

Of the almost 13.5 million cancer patients in the USA, only 100,000 are currently receiving immunotherapy. Together, we can help create awareness of this therapy.

Why is Your Support Necessary?

We chose to run this campaign on Indiegogo because we believe we can reach more socially conscious supporters here, than by any other means. We all know someone who has been affected by cancer. It is not only your financial support but also your feedback that is needed, to make this project as valuable as possible for cancer patients. We believe this is a great opportunity for you to help us create an excited community of early supporters who share our passion for stopping cancer.

Your support will allow the creation of a FREE, comprehensive, online searchable database of immunotherapy options. This idea matters to us and we look forward to making it a reality. 

Not only is your financial support welcome, but your help is needed to get the word out about this project to other possible supporters in your network.

Please email our Indiegogo URL -  https://igg.me/at/ImmunoDigest   - for this project, along with a note of encouragement to participate, to any family or friends who you think might be interested in this project. Also, please use the Indiegogo Share Tools (near the top of this page) to let others about ImmunoDigest.com

We cannot delay any longer.  Cancer patients need to be armed with objective and relevant information about immunologic therapies that may extend their lives and hopefully provide a cure.

Risks and Challenges:

The technical aspect of creating an online, searchable database is relatively simple. The challenge is adding successful case histories to ImmunoDigest.com as this will require a great deal of effort and time. A valuable resource can be completed as outlined in this project, however, to make ImmunoDigest.com an optimal resource with success stories from around the world will take time and more funding in the future. Simply put the more funding that is raised now, the more information about immunologic therapies that will be included on ImmunoDigest.com.

How the Project Will Work:

  • A large community of supporters must be developed with your help.
  • Next, we will step up our efforts to collect successful case histories. Included will be FDA approved immunologic therapies, FDA approved clinical trials and other research that has been used by medical professionals. 
  • We will also collect science-based case histories from international sources. The medical community in Canada, Japan, China, Australia, Israel, and many countries in the European Union have developed successful therapies.
  • The back-end architecture for a web-based searchable database is currently in development and the website ImmunoDigest.com will be completed upon a successful Indiegogo campaign.
  • Next, ImmunoDigest.com will be populated with the accumulated case histories and other data.
  • Upon going live, ImmunoDigest.com will allow patients, advocates, and medical professionals to search by type of cancer, type of immunologic therapy, hospital name, doctor name, country, and the source of information (see sample pages shown).

This is the ultimate use of technology to bring information, health, and longer lives to cancer patients and their families

Use of Funds:

The funds raised on Indiegogo will be used to create ImmunoDigest.com, to compensate researchers, for minimal organizational expenses, and to undertake an initial promotion of ImmunoDigest.com on social media and for other opportunities to create awareness.

In the future, to raise operating funds to keep the information current, ImmunoDigest.com will be offering sponsorship opportunities to well-regarded hospitals and possibly pharmaceutical companies that offer immunologic therapies.  It is expected that ImmunoDigest.com will need to be fully operational before these organizations will be interested in participating.

Eventually, if there is international support, we can translate the site into the most popular languages.

Timeline:

Website development with initial survivor’s success stories will be finished in July 2017

ImmunoDigest.com will go live in August 2017

 

Our Team:

John Livingstone, Project Leader

John lives in the San Diego area and has been a successful entrepreneur for more than 35 years with an emphasis on print publishing and then digital publishing and marketing. John is a graduate of Simon Fraser University in Canada. He is a creative problem-solver with a passion for innovation.  John is the author of Business, Business, Business – The Entrepreneur’s Guide to Strategies, Secrets and Savings, an internationally published book. John will be responsible for the overall vision, management, and growth of ImmunoDigest.com.

 

Kelly Ann Schneider, Project Researcher

Kelly Ann is a third-generation resident of San Diego. She earned a management degree from Cal Poly State University. Kelly Ann has been a very successful Realtor for nearly 20 years, earning many Realtor designations including the advanced designation of Certified International Property Specialist (CIPS).  She has worked closely with John on projects in the areas of research and marketing for many years. Kelly Ann is a passionate and enthusiastic individual. Her responsibilities will include research, sponsorships, and the communication strategy for ImmunoDigest.com.

 

Dr. Joseph Castrejon, Medical Consultant

Board Certified Family Medicine, 1997-present.

Following completion of his residency at the University of Southern California, Dr. Castrejon began practicing family medicine in 1997 in Vista, California.  Dr. Castrejon has been the recipient of the Kellogg Foundation Award for Family Medicine. It was Dr. Castrejon who diagnosed John Livingstone’s cancer in 2007.

 

Vinayak Infotech will create ImmunoDigest.com including software, the database, and data analytics. John Livingstone has a ten-year working relationship with Vinayak Infotech and represents Vinayak Infotech as the USA partner.

Reality Premedia Services will provide graphic design and video services for ImmunoDigest.com. RPS has successfully worked on numerous projects with John Livingstone.

 

Join and Help Build the Team:

ImmunoDigest.com welcomes those with a knowledge of immunology and cancer to contribute to the success of our project. Please email: JohnL@ImmunoDigest.com

Are you a cancer survivor as a result of an immunologic therapy?

We want to hear your stories. Please email Research@ImmunoDigest.com and provide a few details. We will be in touch to learn your story.

Do you have any questions about ImmunoDigest.com you would like to ask?  Please email: Feedback@ImmunoDigest.com   The speed of our response will depend on the number of inquiries on any given day.

Website: http://ImmunoDigest.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ImmunoDigest

Media inquiries. If you are a journalist or blogger, and would like to write about our campaign, please contact: JohnL@ImmunoDigest.com

Feedback: Feedback@ImmunoDigest.comSupport: Support@ImmunoDigest.co
mSponsorship opportunities for medical institutions and corporations: KellyAnn@ImmunoDigest.com

Thank you for sharing our URL  -  https://igg.me/at/ImmunoDigest   -  about this Indiegogo.com project with your friends through emails, on social media, and personal contact with your family and friends.

 

Q & A

Will there be any cost to cancer patients?

No! Absolutely not. ImmunoDigest.com will be a free service for patients and their advocates.

What if Indiegogo supporters contribute more money than the goal?

We are going to include success stories for as many different cancer types as possible. If more money is raised then we will be able to expand our team and provide many more success stories for the database and make it even more valuable. The number of success stories is huge.

This is a complex undertaking. Does the team have the ability to execute this project?

Yes. The founder has been a business owner involved in several complex endeavors in his career, usually involving many personnel, international relationships and often working with CEO’s of corporations and extremely successful entrepreneurs. The other members of the team are all experienced professionals in their respective fields.

Will you be expanding the team at ImmunoDigest.com?

Yes, there are several medical professionals who we expect will join an Advisory Board as ImmunoDigest.com grows and requires their participation. We also have an attorney and a CPA who will join this project to advise on the legal and financial aspects of our growth.

Do you have any plans to add to the mission of ImmunoDigest.com?

Yes, we have four future objectives:

  • Provide specific information on clinical trials and the contact information for the right people to see if a patient might be considered for participation in a clinical trial
  • Provide information on how to appeal adverse insurance company decisions
  • Provide sample letters that can be used for clinical trial applications and appeals
  • Create an international database of major hospitals and research institutions involved in curing cancer through immunology therapies

How will future objectives be paid for?

To accomplish these future objectives, we anticipate financial sponsorships by pharmaceutical companies, hospitals, and research institutions once ImmunoDigest.com is online and proving its value.  Depending on our success, we may conduct another Indiegogo campaign.

Are there any existing resources that provide information about immunologic therapies?

Yes, there are numerous sources of information about immunologic therapies, however, they are usually scholarly articles for medical professionals, not the patient.  Most sources use words like “synthesized IFN-gamma” and “Chemokines” and other terms unfamiliar to patients. No one is writing information that is patient-friendly which is the goal of ImmunoDigest.com

Will non-traditional or non-western medical cancer therapies be included in ImmunoDigest.com?

No. While there may be some treatments that people believe are effective, we will only include those therapies that are supported by the medical community as we understand it in the United States. We expect all treatments will have FDA approval in some form, or by FDA counterparts in other countries with similar standards of proving effectiveness.

Will ImmunoDigest.com provide medical advice?

Absolutely not!  ImmunoDigest.com is a digest, or collection, of existing medical information and published articles where doctors and patients have spoken of or written about Immunologic therapies.

Are there any YouTube videos that explain the success of immunologic therapies?

Yes, below are two of many videos.  Both men are of medical doctors speaking at TEDx Talks.  They have no affiliation with ImmunoDigest.com and are only included here as they have an easy-to-understand explanation of immunologic therapies and their videos are publicly available on YouTube.

The first video is of Michael Jensen, MD, CAR T Cell Expert, Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research, Seattle Childrens Research Institute.  MD earned from the University of Pennsylvania.

Dr. Jensen shares details on an FDA approved cancer treatment with a 91% cure rate for advanced relapsed leukemia.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3kiDfLS0UXQ&t=44s

 

The second video is of C. Jimmy Lin, MD, PhD, MHS, Cancer Genomics Pioneer who received his MD from The John Hopkins School of Medicine. 

Dr. Lin discusses immunotherapy and these types of cancer: colorectal cancer, breast cancer, pancreatic cancer, lung cancer, melanoma, leukemia and brain cancer (glioblastoma) and the cures that have been seen. Dr. Lin describes the therapy as being like “cancer snipers” since a patient’s modified T-cells are so accurate at targeting specific cancer cells.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4tarl95XP1M

What is the history of immunology?

In summary, since 1796 when the first vaccine was created. More recently, the first immunological treatment for cancer was approved in 2010. The first cell-based immunotherapy was approved for treatment of prostate cancer and shortly after CAR therapy was announced. CAR therapy involves genetically modifying each patient’s t-cells to target tumor cells. By mid-2016, the FDA granted three more approvals. Since then, research has led to thousands of clinical trials worldwide. Many research oncologists believe that targeted t-cell therapy will lead to a cure for every type of cancer eventually.

Thank you for your contribution.  Choose your perk now!
story_txt:
My name is John Livingstone and I am a cancer survivor. I am excited about new, but little-known advances in treating cancer with immunologic therapies.  Successful immunologic therapies cause our immune system to reprogram its cells so that they can then kill cancer cells. Please contribute to our project so we can create an easy-to-use database of success stories where patients benefitted from this therapy. Our goal is that cancer patients may learn more about these new medicines and research their own cure. Thank you.Founder’s Cancer Story and Vision:I have discovered even the best cancer doctors cannot know everything!In 2007, I noticed a rash on my skin. My family doctor expressed concern as the area had become quite alarming. He arranged a deep biopsy by a dermatologist. The diagnosis was a rare form of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma.  I was referred to an oncologist who said the prognosis was poor since there was no known cure.The lesson about research that I was about to learn has prompted me to form a team and create ImmunoDigest.com.I am fortunate to have good research skills, probably due to my career as a writer and publisher. I began researching my type of lymphoma and why it was so rare.Research led me to visit Cancer Treatment Centers of America in Tulsa. After extensive testing and consultation, they advised me they had no treatment for my cancer.  They suggested I contact University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston. MD Anderson had the same horrible prognosis.I continued my research and found the proverbial “needle in a haystack” – a doctor at UCLA Medical Center who was studying my type of lymphoma. Her name is Dr. Lauren Pinter-Brown, a Clinical Professor of Medicine. I give thanks to Dr. Joseph Castrejon, my family doctor, and Dr. Pinter-Brown that I am here ten years later.It became clear to me that due to lack of information on the part of some oncologists, patients can die. This is not to fault doctors as they are extremely busy and there are so many new developments to be studied.For most people diagnosed with cancer, especially a potentially terminal case, the ability to research their own case is overwhelming. I have been working for several years on a solution.  I believe ImmunoDigest.com is one answer - an easy-to-use database of immunotherapy success stories so patients may learn more about new medicines and help to research their own cure.What information will be available on ImmunoDigest.com?ImmunoDigest.com will offer:
documented survivors’ stories from mainstream sources (see examples on this page)
reported science-based treatments
information from accredited hospitals and research institutions
It will be a database that is searchable by:
cancer type
cancer location (breast, spleen, lungs, stomach, etc)
immunologic therapies used
hospital or research facility
doctor
country of treatment
source of information (with an active link to the survivor’s success story)
Understanding Immunologic Therapies:Cancer starts with some of a person’s cells becoming cancerous. These cancer cells can become a blood, bone, lung or another type of cancer, which may evolve to become tumors. For some cancers, new drug therapies use the patient’s own cells in their immune system and re-program these cells into tumor-specific T-cells. These re-programmed cells become “weapons” that will destroy the cancerous cells – ideally forever!  It is essentially personalized medicine as everyone’s cancer is different.  The results can be incredible as shown in some of the case studies on this page.Are immunologic therapies supported by research scientists and the medical community?Absolutely! There are an estimated 100,000 cancer patients in the USA being treated with immunologic therapies.  More than 180,000 scientific papers were published in 2016 about immunologic therapies.New immunotherapy treatments are being discovered and used worldwide to cure otherwise terminal patients. Major medical centers in the USA including Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Stanford University, University of California, Los Angeles, University of California, San Francisco, the University of Pennsylvania, and the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center are collaborating with the Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy.  Most major medical centers, offering cancer treatment, are participating in research programs, as well as treating patients.  IBM’s Watson for Genomics, working with Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, is assisting medical personnel by providing personalized approaches and medicine to cancer patients across America and overseas.Two videos of medical doctors explaining immunologic therapies are shown in the Q & A section below.Who will find ImmunoDigest.com useful?Cancer patients (possibly you, a family member or friend) and their advocates who have received an advanced stage, or terminal prognosis will find ImmunoDigest.com useful.Simplifying hundreds of scientific articles, especially successful case histories, into actionable, easy-to-understand information is the goal of ImmunoDigest.comAccording to the National Cancer Institute, on their Cancer.gov website, in 2016 there were an estimated 1,685,000 new cases of cancer in the US and 595,690 deaths. One in four deaths in America is cancer related. Approximately 39% of men and women will be diagnosed with cancer during their lifetimes.Of the almost 13.5 million cancer patients in the USA, only 100,000 are currently receiving immunotherapy. Together, we can help create awareness of this therapy.Why is Your Support Necessary?We chose to run this campaign on Indiegogo because we believe we can reach more socially conscious supporters here, than by any other means. We all know someone who has been affected by cancer. It is not only your financial support but also your feedback that is needed, to make this project as valuable as possible for cancer patients. We believe this is a great opportunity for you to help us create an excited community of early supporters who share our passion for stopping cancer.Your support will allow the creation of a FREE, comprehensive, online searchable database of immunotherapy options. This idea matters to us and we look forward to making it a reality. Not only is your financial support welcome, but your help is needed to get the word out about this project to other possible supporters in your network.Please email our Indiegogo URL -  https://igg.me/at/ImmunoDigest   - for this project, along with a note of encouragement to participate, to any family or friends who you think might be interested in this project. Also, please use the Indiegogo Share Tools (near the top of this page) to let others about ImmunoDigest.comWe cannot delay any longer.  Cancer patients need to be armed with objective and relevant information about immunologic therapies that may extend their lives and hopefully provide a cure.Risks and Challenges:The technical aspect of creating an online, searchable database is relatively simple. The challenge is adding successful case histories to ImmunoDigest.com as this will require a great deal of effort and time. A valuable resource can be completed as outlined in this project, however, to make ImmunoDigest.com an optimal resource with success stories from around the world will take time and more funding in the future. Simply put the more funding that is raised now, the more information about immunologic therapies that will be included on ImmunoDigest.com.How the Project Will Work:A large community of supporters must be developed with your help.Next, we will step up our efforts to collect successful case histories. Included will be FDA approved immunologic therapies, FDA approved clinical trials and other research that has been used by medical professionals. We will also collect science-based case histories from international sources. The medical community in Canada, Japan, China, Australia, Israel, and many countries in the European Union have developed successful therapies.The back-end architecture for a web-based searchable database is currently in development and the website ImmunoDigest.com will be completed upon a successful Indiegogo campaign.Next, ImmunoDigest.com will be populated with the accumulated case histories and other data.Upon going live, ImmunoDigest.com will allow patients, advocates, and medical professionals to search by type of cancer, type of immunologic therapy, hospital name, doctor name, country, and the source of information (see sample pages shown).This is the ultimate use of technology to bring information, health, and longer lives to cancer patients and their familiesUse of Funds:The funds raised on Indiegogo will be used to create ImmunoDigest.com, to compensate researchers, for minimal organizational expenses, and to undertake an initial promotion of ImmunoDigest.com on social media and for other opportunities to create awareness.In the future, to raise operating funds to keep the information current, ImmunoDigest.com will be offering sponsorship opportunities to well-regarded hospitals and possibly pharmaceutical companies that offer immunologic therapies.  It is expected that ImmunoDigest.com will need to be fully operational before these organizations will be interested in participating.Eventually, if there is international support, we can translate the site into the most popular languages.Timeline:Website development with initial survivor’s success stories will be finished in July 2017ImmunoDigest.com will go live in August 2017 Our Team:John Livingstone, Project LeaderJohn lives in the San Diego area and has been a successful entrepreneur for more than 35 years with an emphasis on print publishing and then digital publishing and marketing. John is a graduate of Simon Fraser University in Canada. He is a creative problem-solver with a passion for innovation.  John is the author of Business, Business, Business – The Entrepreneur’s Guide to Strategies, Secrets and Savings, an internationally published book. John will be responsible for the overall vision, management, and growth of ImmunoDigest.com. Kelly Ann Schneider, Project ResearcherKelly Ann is a third-generation resident of San Diego. She earned a management degree from Cal Poly State University. Kelly Ann has been a very successful Realtor for nearly 20 years, earning many Realtor designations including the advanced designation of Certified International Property Specialist (CIPS).  She has worked closely with John on projects in the areas of research and marketing for many years. Kelly Ann is a passionate and enthusiastic individual. Her responsibilities will include research, sponsorships, and the communication strategy for ImmunoDigest.com. Dr. Joseph Castrejon, Medical ConsultantBoard Certified Family Medicine, 1997-present.Following completion of his residency at the University of Southern California, Dr. Castrejon began practicing family medicine in 1997 in Vista, California.  Dr. Castrejon has been the recipient of the Kellogg Foundation Award for Family Medicine. It was Dr. Castrejon who diagnosed John Livingstone’s cancer in 2007. Vinayak Infotech will create ImmunoDigest.com including software, the database, and data analytics. John Livingstone has a ten-year working relationship with Vinayak Infotech and represents Vinayak Infotech as the USA partner.Reality Premedia Services will provide graphic design and video services for ImmunoDigest.com. RPS has successfully worked on numerous projects with John Livingstone. Join and Help Build the Team:ImmunoDigest.com welcomes those with a knowledge of immunology and cancer to contribute to the success of our project. Please email: JohnL@ImmunoDigest.comAre you a cancer survivor as a result of an immunologic therapy?We want to hear your stories. Please email Research@ImmunoDigest.com and provide a few details. We will be in touch to learn your story.Do you have any questions about ImmunoDigest.com you would like to ask?  Please email: Feedback@ImmunoDigest.com   The speed of our response will depend on the number of inquiries on any given day.Website: http://ImmunoDigest.comFacebook: www.facebook.com/ImmunoDigestMedia inquiries. If you are a journalist or blogger, and would like to write about our campaign, please contact: JohnL@ImmunoDigest.comFeedback: Feedback@ImmunoDigest.comSupport: Support@ImmunoDigest.comSponsorship opportunities for medical institutions and corporations: KellyAnn@ImmunoDigest.comThank you for sharing our URL  -  https://igg.me/at/ImmunoDigest   -  about this Indiegogo.com project with your friends through emails, on social media, and personal contact with your family and friends. Q & AWill there be any cost to cancer patients?No! Absolutely not. ImmunoDigest.com will be a free service for patients and their advocates.What if Indiegogo supporters contribute more money than the goal?We are going to include success stories for as many different cancer types as possible. If more money is raised then we will be able to expand our team and provide many more success stories for the database and make it even more valuable. The number of success stories is huge.This is a complex undertaking. Does the team have the ability to execute this project?Yes. The founder has been a business owner involved in several complex endeavors in his career, usually involving many personnel, international relationships and often working with CEO’s of corporations and extremely successful entrepreneurs. The other members of the team are all experienced professionals in their respective fields.Will you be expanding the team at ImmunoDigest.com?Yes, there are several medical professionals who we expect will join an Advisory Board as ImmunoDigest.com grows and requires their participation. We also have an attorney and a CPA who will join this project to advise on the legal and financial aspects of our growth.Do you have any plans to add to the mission of ImmunoDigest.com?Yes, we have four future objectives:Provide specific information on clinical trials and the contact information for the right people to see if a patient might be considered for participation in a clinical trialProvide information on how to appeal adverse insurance company decisionsProvide sample letters that can be used for clinical trial applications and appealsCreate an international database of major hospitals and research institutions involved in curing cancer through immunology therapiesHow will future objectives be paid for?To accomplish these future objectives, we anticipate financial sponsorships by pharmaceutical companies, hospitals, and research institutions once ImmunoDigest.com is online and proving its value.  Depending on our success, we may conduct another Indiegogo campaign.Are there any existing resources that provide information about immunologic therapies?Yes, there are numerous sources of information about immunologic therapies, however, they are usually scholarly articles for medical professionals, not the patient.  Most sources use words like “synthesized IFN-gamma” and “Chemokines” and other terms unfamiliar to patients. No one is writing information that is patient-friendly which is the goal of ImmunoDigest.comWill non-traditional or non-western medical cancer therapies be included in ImmunoDigest.com?No. While there may be some treatments that people believe are effective, we will only include those therapies that are supported by the medical community as we understand it in the United States. We expect all treatments will have FDA approval in some form, or by FDA counterparts in other countries with similar standards of proving effectiveness.Will ImmunoDigest.com provide medical advice?Absolutely not!  ImmunoDigest.com is a digest, or collection, of existing medical information and published articles where doctors and patients have spoken of or written about Immunologic therapies.Are there any YouTube videos that explain the success of immunologic therapies?Yes, below are two of many videos.  Both men are of medical doctors speaking at TEDx Talks.  They have no affiliation with ImmunoDigest.com and are only included here as they have an easy-to-understand explanation of immunologic therapies and their videos are publicly available on YouTube.The first video is of Michael Jensen, MD, CAR T Cell Expert, Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research, Seattle Childrens Research Institute.  MD earned from the University of Pennsylvania.Dr. Jensen shares details on an FDA approved cancer treatment with a 91% cure rate for advanced relapsed leukemia.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3kiDfLS0UXQ&t=44s The second video is of C. Jimmy Lin, MD, PhD, MHS, Cancer Genomics Pioneer who received his MD from The John Hopkins School of Medicine. Dr. Lin discusses immunotherapy and these types of cancer: colorectal cancer, breast cancer, pancreatic cancer, lung cancer, melanoma, leukemia and brain cancer (glioblastoma) and the cures that have been seen. Dr. Lin describes the therapy as being like “cancer snipers” since a patient’s modified T-cells are so accurate at targeting specific cancer cells.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4tarl95XP1MWhat is the history of immunology?In summary, since 1796 when the first vaccine was created. More recently, the first immunological treatment for cancer was approved in 2010. The first cell-based immunotherapy was approved for treatment of prostate cancer and shortly after CAR therapy was announced. CAR therapy involves genetically modifying each patient’s t-cells to target tumor cells. By mid-2016, the FDA granted three more approvals. Since then, research has led to thousands of clinical trials worldwide. Many research oncologists believe that targeted t-cell therapy will lead to a cure for every type of cancer eventually.Thank you for your contribution.  Choose your perk now!

story:
Why?

We are aiming to help a million people get (and keep) a better back

There's so much mediocrity and confusion in the world of Low Back Pain (LBP) treatment.  One thing's for certain - pills don't cure and neither does surgery (though admittedly it often helps in the short-term).  The only known, proven "solutions" to LBP are education and exercise.  But what should clinicians tell you, and which exercises should you do, when and how often?

Pain isn't just a physical thing - it's upsetting.  And that affects the people around you.  There are too many people affected to accept the status quo.  Postural supports can be helpful and have been hugely popular on crowdfunding sites, but it's kind of missing the point.  You've got muscles to hold you up - you shouldn't need external support.  Why do you?

Why a million?  I've helped tens of thousands all ready, and a million seemed like a good round number (and a great stretch-goal).  And hey, if we reach a million, I'm sure we'll reach many more beyond that first million.

Who?

My name is Gavin Routledge

I'm aiming to revolutionize the treatment and prevention of Low Back Pain.  I'm a Gold Medalist Osteopath and Vice Patron of the British School of Osteopathy, with 25 years clinical experience and a Masters Degree in the Clinical Management of Pain from the University of Edinburgh, co-author with Gavin Hastings OBE of The Back Book way back in 1997.  

I've always specialized in LBP and sciatica, partly because of my own experiences with these pains, and also because I find it deeply frustrating to hear of so many people suffering needlessly.  I'd like to help you and thousands of others to do what I've done myself, and what I've helped thousands of others to do.  As I say in the book, you only need three things to recover from LBP (and/or sciatica)

  1. understand why you get that pain
  2. form a recovery plan tailored specifically to you
  3. and stick to that plan. Forever.

"Over the years Gavin has enabled me to avoid surgery by encouraging me to identify the best ways to maintain my back, and recognise when I am stepping too close to the cliff." Valerie Malcolm, 55, Property Manager

How?

I can't see each of the 1 million personally, but by creating the book and website I can provide the education and exercises (tailored to each sufferer's needs).  By supporting this campaign, you can make a lasting difference not just to your own back, but to the futures of thousands of others, maybe millions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book is all ready written and the website has been in Beta testing mode for the last month. The book I've been working on over the last 18 months. Your support will bring the book into print and support the improvement of the website (we're told it's pretty good all ready!).  I've been messing about with websites and content to support my patients for the last 5 years, learning what they use and how they use it, as well as what they don't like.  In 2014 I reviewed 232 apps on the app store for LBP - most were next to useless, some dangerous and none provided what the majority of sufferers need to know. 

The book is a beautifully designed work-book, guiding you to understand the underlying risk factors for your particular back problem, what makes it worse and better and how to create your own program for long-term recovery.

 

The website is based on the knowledge in the book, but - as you'd expect - is interactive and mobile compliant, personalising the advice and exercises.

In order to run off the first 500 books, and pay our initial costs we need £10,000.  Every book bought beyond that helps to fund the further development of the website (as well as pay for the printing of the book you order). 

If we were to fall short of the target, I will back the book myself, and you'll receive the copy you've paid for in your chosen perk.  However, I want to do this with a community who care about empowering themselves and others. Using Indiegogo to launch the book, website and campaign, I hope that we can grow more rapidly (with your help) and reach more people whose lives are blighted unnecessarily.

Backing the website alone is an option, and will ensure that it becomes the gold-standard in "patient-centered" digital health care.  The funds will go toward the development of habit-changing / coaching tools on the site, and the associated running costs of a data-intensive, interactive web platform.  We've all ready integrated the web app with Fitbit, so if you have a Fitibt, you can view your back stats alongside your activity stats - very useful!  If there are enough funds, the next stage of development will be a mobile app to accompany the site, but that may have to wait for another stage of the campaign - it's really up to you ;-)

If you get in early, you can back the book and/or the website at a reduced price.

You can also opt for the personal touch, connecting with me in a Skype consultation, and backing the book and the website all at the same time.

If you're responsible for the well-being of others, then there are the "Big Backer" options, where I'll come out to your office and deliver an engaging workshop focused on the avoidance of back pain as well as providing access to the website for 12 months for groups of users.

I know that if you support this campaign and share it with friends and family, we can smash this target and make big strides towards the million better backs goal!

If we don't reach our entire goal, your pledge will go towards the part you've chosen to support. If you back the book, you will receive a copy.  If you back the website you will gain access to it at the end of the campaign period.

The Impact

Remember, LBP causes a huge amount of pain and suffering.  60% of LBP sufferers will have another episode within a year... We can save someone from going through that, or at least speed up their recovery and reduce the risk of it happening again.  

The goal to help a million people might seem like a huge stretch goal, but when you consider there are about a billion people with a sore back today, we're only talking one thousandth of that.  If you share the campaign with your friends and family, and everyone does that, we could - by the power of networks - easily reach that goal.  By sharing, you can help other people - and that feels good. Believe me - I help people every day, and it feels good. ;-)

I've never run a crowd-funding campaign before, but because LBP is so common it seemed like something a lot of people would care enough about to "back" and to share with others. Helping people is what I've done professionally for 25 years.  I'd just like to help a lot more than I have done so far (just over 21,000).

Risks & Challenges

There aren't a lot of risks in backing this campaign.  The book is written and designed.  There's all ready a website - I just want to improve it, and that takes time and money.

We have worked with groups of LBP sufferers and Glasgow School of Art Design Innovation team in shaping the web development and we plan to work with Edinburgh University School of Design Informatics on the improvements to the website.  Improvements will take time, but we employ a "SCRUM" approach to software development and this has worked well to get us this far.  21 LBP/sciatica sufferers provided feedback on the content of the book at various stages through its 5 re-writes and many edits.

Managing your funds is pretty straight-forward; I've run a business for 23 years.  I look after people's health... I can certainly look after your money!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just don't feel you can afford to help support the campaign financially, please share it with friends and family - maybe someone will buy the book for you!!  Remember how many people suffer from LBP and sciatica - please share and help them to get better.

Whether you back the campaign or not, please click the social share buttons on this page.

"Seventeen years nursing, a scuba diving accident, and several years driving as a medical sales rep., resulted in more than ten years of quite debilitating back pain. Gavin straightened me up, and I've pretty much stayed there for the last fifteen years." Anne Maver, 57, Pharmacy Student

story:
Ciclebox is brought to you by people who live and breathe cycling with a passion for all things bike. With so many cycling related items to choose from, we know how important quality and value is to a keen bike rider. By choosing to become a member of the Ciclebox family, you'll be guaranteed to receive a selection of some of the best cycling and health products available, all for an unbelievable low monthly price.

We are now ready to launch Ciclebox to the world of cycling through Indiegogo.

We are hoping to raise £30,000 or more. This will allow us to negotiate better deals on your behalf with some of the world's leading cycling product manufacturers. We already have a whole host of established and exciting new brands on board offering a massive selection of products, but we need more and through your support, we can make Ciclebox the very best it can be.

Everything from top quality cycling gadgets, bike spares, fashion, safety items, health and nutrition. All you need to keep your body, your mind and your bike running in perfect harmony.

Your Ciclebox should surprise you every month. But to help you decide whether or not you think we deserve your support, we've put together a list of what's guaranteed in your first three boxes:

Ciclebox offers an awesome monthly subscription. By joining Ciclebox through our crowdfunding campaign, you'll receive up to a 44% discount on our normal subscription price. Furthermore, all Indiegogo backers will receive an extra gift bundle with goodies from our friends at Erdinger Akolholfrei and Alpecin.

We need your help to reach our target. It's simple economics: the more help you can give us, the better value for money we can give YOU.
